message.content:
1. Riociguat was used on inoperable patients.
2. The number of inoperable patients treated with Riociguat was 189.
3. Riociguat decreased pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) in inoperable patients.
4. The least-squares mean difference of PVR in inoperable patients treated with Riociguat was -285 dyn s/cm5.
5. The 95% confidence interval for the decrease in PVR in inoperable patients treated with Riociguat was -357 to -213.
6. The p-value for the decrease in PVR in inoperable patients treated with Riociguat was less than 0.0001.
7. Riociguat was used on persistent/recurrent patients.
8. The number of persistent/recurrent patients treated with Riociguat was 72.
9. Riociguat decreased pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) in persistent/recurrent patients.
10. The least-squares mean difference of PVR in persistent/recurrent patients treated with Riociguat was -131 dyn s/cm5.
11. The 95% confidence interval for the decrease in PVR in persistent/recurrent patients treated with Riociguat was -214 to -48.
12. The p-value for the decrease in PVR in persistent/recurrent patients treated with Riociguat was 0.0025.

messages.content:
Statement: Riociguat decreased pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) in inoperable (n=189; least-squares mean difference: −285 dyn s/cm5 (95% CI −357 to −213); p<0.0001) and persistent/recurrent (n=72; −131 dyn s/cm5 (95% CI −214 to −48); p=0.0025) patients.

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
